CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 with regard to the civil proceedings;Violation of Art. 6-1 with regard to the criminal proceedings;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant worked as the head of the sales department in a coal mine “ Rozbark ” in ORG . On DATE she was dismissed from her job .

CARDINAL . On DATE she lodged a claim for compensation and reinstatement with ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy Wydział Pracy ) . Before DATE the trial court held CARDINAL hearings and heard evidence from CARDINAL witness .

CARDINAL . On DATE the parties reached a friendly settlement and ORG discontinued the proceedings . On DATE the applicant ’s lawyer asked the court to resume the proceedings , as the defendant company had failed to comply with the terms of the settlement . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Wojewódzki ) quashed the decision of DATE and resumed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing . On DATE it stayed the proceedings until the conclusion of criminal proceedings against the applicant ( referred to below ) . The applicant ’s further appeal against that decision was dismissed by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked the court to resume the proceedings . On DATE the court held a hearing . On DATE it dismissed her application . On DATE , on the applicant ’s appeal , ORG resumed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the court held CARDINAL hearings and heard evidence from CARDINAL witnesses . On DATE the ORG gave judgment . The court granted the applicant compensation and dismissed her claim for reinstatement . Both parties appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG held hearings . On DATE the applicant sent a letter to the President of ORG asking for a hearing date to be set .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the defendant ’s appeal . DATE ORG gave judgment and dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . The judgment is final .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Prokurator Rejonowy ) submitted to ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) a bill of indictment against the applicant and CARDINAL other employees of the “ LOC coal mine . The applicant was charged with carrying out fraudulent financial operations . On DATE the ORG returned the case - file to ORG instructing him to complete the investigation . ORG appealed . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Wojewódzki ) ordered ORG to proceed with the case .
CARDINAL . During the proceedings ORG held QUANTITY hearings and heard evidence from several witnesses .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG delivered a judgment and acquitted the applicant . ORG appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case to the prosecution authorities for a further investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered an expert opinion to be obtained . The expert submitted his opinion on DATE . On DATE the ORG decided to stay the investigation until an expert on management prepared an opinion .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent a letter to ORG complaining about the slow progress of the proceedings . On DATE she sent another letter to the Minister of ORG ( Minister PERSON ) asking about the progress of the investigation proceedings . In a letter of DATE the ORG informed the applicant that there were difficulties in finding an expert competent to prepare an opinion .
